author: Staff
title: Legal Compensation Options in Mesothelioma Cases
text:
Mesothelioma is a rare but aggressive cancer caused by prolonged exposure to asbestos. It primarily affects individuals who have worked in industries where asbestos was widely used, such as shipbuilding, construction, and manufacturing. As the disease has a long latency period, on average it takes up to 40 years to be diagnosed.
Since there is currently no cure for mesothelioma, treatment typically involves a combination of surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy. These medical interventions can place a significant financial strain on patients and their families, in addition to the physical and emotional toll of the disease.
However, individuals diagnosed with mesothelioma may have legal options to seek compensation from responsible parties, such as former employers or manufacturers, who exposed them to asbestos. For many claimants, seeking justice in such cases is not just about receiving compensation but also about ensuring that negligent companies are held accountable for the harm caused by asbestos exposure.
If you or a loved one has been diagnosed with mesothelioma, you may be eligible to file a legal claim to recover damages. In this article, we will review the most common legal options for compensation in a mesothelioma lawsuit .
Personal Injury Lawsuits
A mesothelioma patient can file a personal injury lawsuit against a company or employer responsible for their asbestos exposure. To succeed, the claimant must demonstrate that the defendant was negligent and that their exposure directly led to the illness. Compensation in these cases may cover medical expenses, lost wages, pain and suffering, and other financial burdens associated with the disease.
Out-of-Court Settlements
Many mesothelioma cases are resolved through settlements rather than going to trial. A settlement allows the plaintiff to receive compensation more quickly, without the uncertainty and lengthy process of a court case. Defendants often prefer settlements to avoid reputational damage and prolonged litigation. However, the settlement amount may be lower than what might be awarded to a plaintiff or their family in a trial.
Asbestos Trust Funds
Many asbestos manufacturers have declared bankruptcy, but they were required to set up trust funds to compensate mesothelioma victims. Individuals exposed to asbestos through these companies may be able to file a claim with a trust fund rather than pursuing a lawsuit. These funds help ensure that victims receive financial support for medical bills, lost income, and other expenses related to their diagnosis.
Wrongful Death Claims
Photo by MART PRODUCTIOIN from Pexels If a mesothelioma patient passes away, their family members may be entitled to pursue a wrongful death claim . This type of lawsuit seeks compensation for funeral costs, remaining medical expenses, loss of companionship, and the pain and suffering endured by the deceased and their loved ones.
Seeking Legal Assistance
Navigating a mesothelioma claim can be complex, and having an experienced attorney can significantly improve your chances of securing fair compensation. A skilled mesothelioma lawyer can evaluate your case, determine the best legal course of action, and guide you through the process.
If you or a family member has been affected by mesothelioma, exploring your legal options can help ease the financial burden and hold responsible parties accountable.

author: Heidi Schmidt
title: Kansas City suburb has one of most charming Main Streets in US, ranking says
text: PARKVILLE, Mo. (KCTV) - A Kansas City suburb known for it’s charm has some new bragging rights. Mixbook , a photo book company, just ranked what it believes are cities with America’s Most Charming Main Streets . Parkville , Mo. came in at No. 68 on the list. The area was recognized for it’s location near the Missouri River and English Landing Park. It also picked up points for the number of shops, galleries, and the historic train depot found on Main Street. Branson, Mo., did a little better, ranking No. 60 on the list. The ranking included it’s live music theaters, Silver Dollar City, lakes, and Ozark Mountain Christmas that add to its charm. ALSO READ: Trapped ‘birdie’ interrupts play at Overland Park Top Golf location Main Street in St. Charles can be found in the No. 84 spot on the list. The community offers 19th-century brink buildings and a picturesque setting as backdrops for its antique stores, boutiques, and art galleries. Mixbook listed the following cities as those with the most charming Main Streets: - King Street, Charleston, South Carolina - Main Street, Lake Placid, New York - Marin Street, Beacon, New York - Main Street, Montpelier, Vermont - E Las Olas Boulevard, Fort Lauderdale, Florida - Broughton Street, Savanah, Georgia - King Street, Alexandria, Virginia - Broadway Street/Biltmore Ave., Ashville, North Carolina - Washington Avenue, Ocean Springs, Mississippi - Main Street, Eureka Springs, Arkansas ALSO READ: Demand for New Heights hats soars since Taylor Swift wore one at Coachella The complete ranking is available online at https://www.mixbook.com/inspiration/americas-100-most-charming-main-streets. author: @andaluciainf
title: La llegada de borrascas dejará una Semana Santa marcada por la lluvia, la nieve y el frío | Andalucía Información. Todas las noticias de Cádiz
text: l comienzo de la Semana Santa vendrá acompañado de "un cambio de tiempo importante" debido a la llegada de borrascas atlánticas que darán lugar a precipitaciones en amplias zonas del país acompañadas de un ambiente más frío para la época, sobre todo a partir del Jueves Santo, ha explicado Rubén del Campo, portavoz de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet). A partir del Jueves Santo y siguientes días, el portavoz ha precisado que las lluvias persistirán en buena parte de la península, más abundantes en el oeste y en puntos de la zona centro, y menos probables en el Mediterráneo. Para este viernes lo más destacado es la situación en las islas Canarias, donde una Dana dejará lluvias y chubascos localmente fuertes en Tenerife y en las islas Orientales, que serán de nieve por encima de unos 2.000 metros, además de rachas intensas de viento y temperaturas más bajas. En la península, sin embargo, el tiempo va a estar más tranquilo, con lluvia solo en puntos del Cantábrico y presencia de polvo en suspensión en muchas zonas, y un ambiente cálido para la época que dejará máximas de 25 grados en amplias zonas del país y hasta 30 grados en el Valle del Guadalquivir. El sábado continuará el tiempo revuelto en Canarias con chubascos intensos de nieve en las cumbres de las islas más montañosas y vientos fuertes, mientras que se iniciará un descenso "acusado y extraordinario" de los valores en el norte, que podría ser de más de 10 grados con respecto al día anterior. Así, Pamplona o Vitoria pasarán de tener el viernes 25 o 26 grados a tan solo 14 o 15 grados el sábado; Sin embargo, en el resto del territorio peninsular no habrá grandes cambios y seguirá el tiempo cálido para la época, con 30 grados en puntos del Guadalquivir. El domingo continuarán las lluvias en Canarias, ya menos intensas y tendentes a remitir a lo largo del día, conforme la Dana se aleje del archipiélago para acercase a la península, donde dejará chubascos y tormentas en puntos de Andalucía, sobre todo en Sierra Nevada y en el sur de la Comunidad andaluza. En el resto del territorio, tiempo estable con temperaturas que bajarán en el área mediterránea peninsular y en Baleares y no variarán en el resto: Castellón y Alicante tendrán un Domingo de Ramos fresco, con temperaturas que apenas alcanzarán los 20 grados, aunque todavía Córdoba, Granada o Sevilla rondarán los 30 grados. Para el lunes se espera el acercamiento de una borrasca a la península que propiciará un "cambio de tiempo significativo" con valores que bajarán "notablemente" en prácticamente toda España, salvo en el Cantábrico, donde subirán, y con lluvias en casi todo el país. Esa jornada la cota de nieve bajará hasta los 600-1.000 metros en el noroeste y a unos 1.000 metros en el resto de la mitad norte y puntos del centro. Del Campo ha pronosticado que para el martes el tiempo continuará "revuelto" con lluvias en casi cualquier punto del país, aunque con menor probabilidad en el sureste de la península, mientras que las más abundantes se darán en Pirineos y montañas andaluzas y con nevadas copiosas en montañas del norte y centro peninsular. En este punto, el portavoz ha recalcado que "el martes también puede nevar en zonas más bajas, especialmente de la meseta norte", mientras que las temperaturas bajarán de nuevo con diurnas por debajo de los 15 grados e incluso 10 grados en amplias zonas del interior, sin embargo en la costa mediterránea se superarán los 20 o 22 grados. El miércoles amanecerá con algunas heladas en zonas de montaña y en puntos de la meseta y páramos del centro, aunque este día ya habrá una clara recuperación de las diurnas, con una subida de la cota de nieve, ya restringida a montañas, y con lluvias en amplias zonas, más abundantes en Galicia y noroeste, y menos probables en el sureste. A partir del Jueves Santo y días siguientes, lo más probable es que continúe el paso de frentes asociados a borrascas atlánticas, con probabilidad de lluvias en amplias zonas, sobre todo del oeste y zona centro, y menos probables en las regiones mediterráneas. Respecto a las temperaturas subirán ese festivo, aunque es probable que bajen en jornadas siguientes, con valores templados en el tercio oriental de la península y en Baleares, pero en el resto serán valores propios de la época o incluso algo frescos en el oeste de la península. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: هسبريس
title: رغم التدابير الوقائية .. الملاريا المستوردة تواصل اختراق الحدود المغربية
text:
دعا أمين التهراوي، وزير الصحة والحماية الاجتماعية، إلى تعزيز وعي مهنيي الصحة بأهمية الوقاية من الملاريا لدى المسافرين المتوجهين إلى بلدان ذات خطر الإصابة. وكشف التهراوي، في دورية له حول تحيين “الوقاية الكيميائية من الملاريا المستوردة”، أنه، وبشكل سنوي، يتم تسجيل 550 حالة ملاريا مستوردة إلى المملكة، وبالأساس في صفوف المسافرين المغاربة والأجانب القادمين من […]
رغم التدابير الوقائية .. الملاريا المستوردة تواصل اختراق الحدود المغربية Hespress - هسبريس جريدة إلكترونية مغربية.
مشاهدة رغم التدابير الوقائية الملاريا المستوردة تواصل اختراق الحدود المغربية
يذكر بـأن الموضوع التابع لـ رغم التدابير الوقائية الملاريا المستوردة تواصل اختراق الحدود المغربية قد تم نشرة ومتواجد على هسبريس وقد قام فريق التحرير في برس بي بالتاكد منه وربما تم التعديل علية وربما قد يكون تم نقله بالكامل اوالاقتباس منه ويمكنك قراءة ومتابعة مستجدادت هذا الخبر او الموضوع من مصدره الاساسي.
وختاما نتمنى ان نكون قد قدمنا لكم من موقع Pressbee تفاصيل ومعلومات، رغم التدابير الوقائية .. الملاريا المستوردة تواصل اختراق الحدود المغربية.

author: @agensir
title: Papa Francesco: quarta stazione, “non si può fare a meno di una madre che ci rimette a posto nel mondo” - AgenSIR
text: “Gesù, i tuoi ti hanno abbandonato, Giuda ti ha tradito, Pietro rinnegato: sei rimasto solo con la croce. Ma ecco tua madre. Non servono parole, bastano i suoi occhi, che sanno guardare in faccia la sofferenza e farsene carico”. E’ la descrizione dell’incontro tra Gesù e sua madre, al centro della quarta stazione della Via Crucis che il Papa presiederà stasera al Colosseo. “Gesù, nello sguardo pieno di lacrime e di luce di Maria ritrovi la memoria della tenerezza, delle carezze, delle braccia amorevoli che ti hanno sempre accolto e sostenuto”, scrive il Papa nella meditazione: “Lo sguardo materno è lo sguardo della memoria, che ci fonda nel bene”. “Non si può fare a meno di una madre che ci mette al mondo, ma neppure di una madre che ci rimette a posto nel mondo”, sintetizza Francesco: “Tu lo sai e dalla croce ci dai la tua stessa madre. Ecco tua madre, dici al discepolo, a ognuno di noi: dopo l’Eucaristia, ci dai Maria, dono estremo prima di morire”. “Gesù, il tuo cammino è stato confortato dal ricordo del suo amore; anche il mio cammino ha bisogno di fondarsi nella memoria del bene”, osserva Francesco: “Mi accorgo, però, che la mia preghiera è povera di memoria: veloce, sbrigativa, una lista di bisogni per oggi e domani”. “Maria, ferma la mia corsa, aiutami a fare memoria: a custodire la grazia, a ricordare il perdono e i prodigi di Dio, a ravvivare il primo amore, a riassaporare le meraviglie della provvidenza, a piangere di gratitudine”, l’’invocazione alla Padre. E poi la preghiera: “Signore, ravviva in me il ricordo del tuo amore. Quando riemergono le ferite del passato Signore, ravviva in me il ricordo del tuo amore. Quando smarrisco il senso e il filo delle cose Signore, ravviva in me il ricordo del tuo amore. Quando perdo di vista i doni che ho ricevuto Signore, ravviva in me il ricordo del tuo amore. Quando perdo di vista il dono che sono Signore, ravviva in me il ricordo del tuo amore. Quando mi dimentico di ringraziarti Signore, ravviva in me il ricordo del tuo amore”.

author: gqlshare
title: Northern lights may be visible in much of upper US on Thursday, Friday. Here’s how to chase them
text:
Zoë Jackson | (TNS) The Minnesota Star Tribune
MINNEAPOLIS — Still haven’t caught a glimpse of those shimmery northern lights? Sky watchers have a good chance to snag one of those popular aurora borealis photos at the end of this week thanks to a “severe” geomagnetic storm expected to reach Earth on Thursday.
The Space Weather Prediction Center has issued a G4 (Severe) storm watch for Thursday and Friday after a fast coronal mass ejection (CME) erupted from the sun on Sunday night.
“The aurora may become visible over much of the northern half of the country, and maybe as far south as Alabama to northern California,” according to an alert from the center.
Watches at this level are rare though this year has already produced some jaw-dropping opportunities for sky watchers. In May, the Space Weather Prediction Center issued a G5 storm watch, its highest level.
We chatted with some seasoned celestial chasers to learn some of their best tips for catching a glimpse of the northern lights next time they flicker across Minnesota skies — which could happen as soon as Thursday night.
Plenty of first-timers got lucky with the bright auroras visible to the naked eye on May 10 and 11 — and even, in some cases, within the light-polluted Twin Cities. Solar storms of that strength are incredibly rare, said Matthew Vinge, an aurora enthusiast who has chased the lights dozens of times.
“When these warnings go out you got to be OK with failing a bunch of times,” Vinge said. “This is a pretty primitive science.”
But signs point to the possibility of more shows in the coming months. The sun is entering its most active period in two decades, which scientists say is the main driver of the frequency of green and purple sky shows.
The unpredictable nature of the northern lights is what aurora and storm chaser Melanie Metz said she loves about the adventure.
“To have the timing just right and to be in the right place when it hits in the middle of the night, at some point in time … it’s really quite a challenge,” Metz said.
Here are seven tips to help set you up for a successful night hunting for the elusive aurora borealis.
1. Keep an eye on predictions
The Space Weather Prediction Center puts out a daily graphic that makes it easy to check current and forecasted space weather conditions, Metz said. Keep an eye on the local weather, too — if it’s cloudy or rainy, you’re not likely to see much of anything.
“If it looks pretty good that night then you want to start thinking ahead and planning for a place to get away from the city lights,” Metz said.
2. Use dark sky maps for planning
Light pollution maps are handy ways to search potential locations. Big cities and even small towns are best avoided.
“Even though people did see them in the metro the show was exponentially better the farther north you got,” Vinge said.
3. Be ready to drive
To get away from the light-polluted areas, be prepared to drive at least an hour away. It’s possible to get good views within 60 to 90 minutes. The most serious aurora sleuths go all the way to northern Minnesota, which boasts the state’s darkest spots including the internationally certified dark sky areas of Voyageurs National Park and the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness.
4. Look north
A good northern view is key. A northern expanse over a body of water like a lake makes for easy viewing.
“If you do find a lake you want to be on the south shore of that lake so that you can shoot to the north facing the northern horizon,” Metz said.
Plus, it makes for gorgeous photos of the aurora reflecting on the lake.
5. Turn off ambient lights
Once you get out of the car, cut the headlights and cell lights to let your eyes adjust to the darkness. You may begin to see some colors and stripes dancing across the sky.
6. Pack right
Warm clothing, good socks and hand warmers are helpful for long nights chasing the aurora. Snacks, too. If you plan to bring your camera, a tripod is crucial.
7. Capture the moment
If using your phone camera, set it to a long exposure between three and 10 seconds, to reveal even more colors.
“Smartphones have such good cameras these days that they can turn out really well. It’s good if you have a little phone tripod so you can put your phone on that tripod and keep it still,” Metz said. “That’s gonna get you a sharper image for sure.”
8. Be patient
Auroras tend to ebb and flow throughout the night, revealing different peaks and valleys. There are going to be times when they are inactive and times when they will be going crazy, Vinge said.
“If you’re going to go out, plan on going out for at least a couple hours,” he said.

author: The Business Research Company
title: Sustainable Aviation Fuel Market Expected to Achieve 47% CAGR
text:
Sustainable Aviation Fuel Market Expected to Achieve 47% CAGR by 2029: Growth Forecast Insights 07-31-2025 06:21 AM CET | Aerospace & Defense
Press release from: The Business Research Company Sustainable Aviation Fuel Market
Use code ONLINE30 to get 30% off on global market reports and stay ahead of tariff changes, macro trends, and global economic shifts
How Large Will the Sustainable Aviation Fuel Market Size By 2025?
There has been tremendous growth in the sustainable aviation fuel market in past years. With a massive leap from $0.79 billion in 2024 to an estimated $1.22 billion in 2025, the market is expected to achieve a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 53.7%. This significant growth in the recent years can be attributed to the growing concerns about climatic changes, which has surged the demand for sustainable aviation fuel. The increase in the need for lessening GHG emissions, the global emphasis on curbing carbon emissions, and wide-ranging initiatives for carbon reduction have also significantly contributed to this growth.
How Big Is the Sustainable Aviation Fuel Market Size Expected to Grow by 2029?
The market size of sustainable aviation fuel is anticipated to experience a significant increase in the coming years. The market is projected to ramp up to $5.69 billion by 2029, reflecting a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 47.0%. The anticipated growth during this forecast period is primarily due to an amplified employment of sustainable aviation fuel, burgeoning demand for SAF from airline companies worldwide, efforts to enhance supply chain processes to stimulate market growth, and the existence of strict environmentally-focused regulations. Key trends predicted for this forecast period encompass technological progress aligned with rigorous government regulations, advancements in SAF production technologies and diversification of feedstock, technological progression, joint initiatives, and carbon offsetting programs.
View the full report here:
https://www.thebusinessresearchcompany.com/report/sustainable-aviation-fuel-global-market-report
Which Key Market Drivers Powering Sustainable Aviation Fuel Market Expansion and Growth?
The sustainable aviation fuel market is expected to experience significant growth, largely due to the increased adoption of biofuels. Biofuels, which are renewable energy sources derived from plant, algal, or animal biomass, are becoming widely accepted owing to the global push for sustainable practices and the commitment of the aviation industry to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. By using biofuels, airlines can cut down on their carbon emissions and environmental impact. To illustrate, data from Eurostat, based in Luxembourg, reported in December 2023 that renewable energy made up 23.0% of the total energy consumption within the European Union (EU) in 2022, marking a rise from 21.9% in 2021. Furthermore, the percentage of renewable energy utilized in transport climbed to 9.6% in 2022, up from 9.1% in 2021. Hence, the uptick in the use of biofuels is fuelling the expansion of the sustainable aviation fuel market.
Get your free sample here:
https://www.thebusinessresearchcompany.com/sample.aspx?id=14514&type=smp
Which Fast-Growing Trends Are Poised to Disrupt the Sustainable Aviation Fuel Market?
Major firms involved in the sustainable aviation fuel marketplace are championing innovative mechanisms, such as fuel process technologies, in an effort to diminish aviation's environmental footprint. Fuel processing technology deals with the scientific and technological components involved in handling and implementing clean fuels, related chemicals, advanced carbon materials and by-products. For instance, Lummus Technology, an American company known for its process technologies and valuable energy solutions, launched an ethanol-fueled sustainable aviation fuel technology in September 2023. This innovation provides operators a considerable, commercially verified solution for greenhouse gas emission reduction in the aviation sector. Lummus' technology transitions ethanol to sustainable aviation fuel and offers a dependable and secure solution by integrating ethanol to ethylene (EtE), olefin oligomerization, and hydrogenation technologies in a process structure that optimizes SAF yield while reducing capital costs (CAPEX), CO2-specific operational costs (OPEX), and carbon emissions.
What Are the Emerging Segments in the Sustainable Aviation Fuel Market?
The sustainable aviation fuel market covered in this report is segmented -
1) By Fuel Type: Biofuel, Power-to-Liquid, Gas-to-Liquid
2) By Blending Capacity: Below 30%, 30% To 50%, Above 50%
3) By Platform: Commercial Aviation, Military Aviation, Business And General Aviation, Unmanned Aerial Vehicles
Subsegments:
1) By Biofuel: Biojet Fuel, Algae-based Biofuels, Vegetable Oil-based Biofuels, Waste Oil and Animal Fat-based Biofuels
2) By Power-to-Liquid: Electro-fuel (e-fuel) Production from Renewable Energy, Hydrogen-based Power-to-Liquid Fuels, CO2-to-fuel Technologies
3) By Gas-to-Liquid: Fischer-Tropsch Synthetic Fuels, Coal-to-Liquid (CTL) Fuels, Natural Gas-to-Liquid (GTL) Fuels

author: Mieka Smiles
title: 2024 celebrations pictured: How people around the world rang in the new year | World | News | Express.co.uk
text:
Happy New Year! The New Year’s celebrations in the UK may have taken a bit of a battering due to raging weather. But that didn’t stop 100,000 ticket holders from storming to London to watch the capital’s biggest ever firework display.
So how did other countries say hello to 2024? Here we take a look at some of the ways people celebrated the turning of a new chapter in pictures - from a huge party in Times Square, New York through to New Year's Day dips around the world.
Some of the most stylish celebrations are caught on camera below.
Rapper LL Cool J was among the artists to ring in the new year at a party in Times Square, New York.
(Image: Getty) Link copied
There were spectacular fireworks in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, as the country said hello to 2024.
(Image: Getty) Link copied
In Kenya they let the bulls battle it out to mark the turning of a page to a new year in a 'bullfighting extravaganza'.
(Image: Getty) Link copied
In Slovenia keen swimmers dove headfirst into 2024 - and left the water feeling fresh on January 1.
(Image: Getty) Link copied Read Get
Indonesians celebrated with music and dancing in the street in Jakarta to mark a new chapter.
(Image: Getty) Link copied ❮ 1 2 NEXT View 3 more photos ❯

author: yahoo
title: President Joe Biden says he will not pardon his son Hunter Biden if he's convicted on gun-related charges
text:
Read full article NBC News President Joe Biden says he will not pardon his son Hunter Biden if he's convicted on gun-related charges Dareh Gregorian June 7, 2024 at 12:45 AM · 2 min read 31 Link Copied
Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below
President Joe Biden told ABC News in an interview Thursday that he will accept whatever a jury decides in his son Hunter Biden 's criminal trial and that he will not use his presidential power to pardon him if he's convicted.
Biden made his brief statements on his son's historic trial in an interview with ABC News anchor David Muir in Normandy, where Biden and other dignitaries were taking part in a service to commemorate the 80th anniversary of D-Day , a turning point for the Allied forces in World War II.
Asked if he would rule out a pardon for his son, who's facing three federal gun-related charges in court in Delaware, Biden answered simply, "Yes." Asked if he would accept the outcome of the jury trial, a first for an offspring of a sitting president, he again replied, "Yes."
The White House had previously said Biden would not use his pardon power on Hunter Biden, who is also facing a trial on federal tax charges in September. Presidents have the power to grant pardons in federal cases, but not state cases. “I’ve been very clear; the president is not going to pardon his son,” White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters in December.
In a statement when the trial started Monday, Biden said: “As the President, I don’t and won’t comment on pending federal cases, but as a Dad, I have boundless love for my son, confidence in him, and respect for his strength. Our family has been through a lot together, and Jill and I are going to continue to be there for Hunter and our family with our love and support.” The first lady has attended the trial most of this week along with Hunter Biden's wife, Melissa Cohen-Biden, and various other family members.
In the ABC interview, Biden also took aim at former President Donald Trump for refusing to accept a New York jury finding him guilty of 34 charges of falsifying business records last month, and calling the case "rigged." Biden said Trump was trying to "undermine" the rule of law.
"He got a fair trial. The jury spoke," Biden said.
This article was originally published on NBCNews.com
